issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Capacity Scheduler delay scheduling should not be disabled by default.
Enabling it to number of nodes in one rack.

Thanks,
Mayank
fields.summary: Capacity Scheduler delay scheduling should not be disabled by default

comments.body:
Attaching patch

Thanks,
Mayank

{color:green}+1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12570036/YARN-408-trunk.patch
  against trunk revision .

    {color:green}+1 @author{color}.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    {color:green}+1 tests included{color}.  The patch appears to include 1 new or modified test files.

    {color:green}+1 javac{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    {color:green}+1 javadoc{color}.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    {color:green}+1 eclipse:eclipse{color}.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    {color:green}+1 findbugs{color}.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    {color:green}+1 release audit{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    {color:green}+1 core tests{color}.  The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-resourcemanager.

    {color:green}+1 contrib tests{color}.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-YARN-Build/412//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-YARN-Build/412//console

This message is automatically generated.

Can you please provide more detail.  Having it on by default makes it easy for someone to have it set incorrectly since clusters have varying size.  I think the idea of setting it to the number of racks was to balance the time you delay vs getting exact locality.  Do you have any data on the reason for changing it?

Yeah sure.

There are two intents to change this value 

1. Make it enable by default
2. The algorithm which we use to check for the applications to get the scheduling opportunity is based on heart beat from the NM , hence if we just use the number of racks it will not be much of the value add for actually to achieve the node locality. The intent of using the number of delay is to actually at least wait for one heart beat from each node in the cluster and then move task to next locality level.

I defaulted it to number of nodes in one rack generally.

Thanks,
Mayank

Looks good to me! Thanks Mayank.

I'll re-kick hudson to be sure...
Re-kicking hudson.

Agree with the general sentiment. I've seen repeatedly how the default of -1 is really bad with many users.

Kicking Jenkins for real. Will commit it once I get back the blessings.
